messages.subject: Re: Digest Number 215
messages.msgSnippet: Brigitte, Thanks!  I went to the site and bookmarked it so that I could go back again later. I am going to do my best to talk my husband into a getaway with
messages.messageBody:
Brigitte,
Thanks! I went to the site and bookmarked it so that I could go back
again later.
I am going to do my best to talk my husband into a getaway with just the two
of us.
We haven't been alone together in over 17 years. We need it! I'm not sure
we will know how to act without our kids around though! LOL
Tami

messages.subject: Re: Digest Number 215
messages.msgSnippet: ... about ... they ... see ... the ... (after ... minister ... removed, ... for ... two ... husband ... (big ... could ... we ... Tami, Sounds a great time to
messages.messageBody:
> You know, this idea has occurred to me and my husband. We joked
about
> the idea that if he took one of those tests right now (you know, where
they
> rate all the stressful things that have happened to you in one year, to
see
> how you would rate on being stressed out?), that he would probably be at
the
> top of the chart.
> Lets see, he changed jobs (after 17 yrs), we moved to a new home
(after
> 9 years), his grandmother died, something very major happened to our
minister
> at church (he had been there 18 years), my dad had a cancerous tumor
removed,
> I started a new in-home business, a close friend (whose husband left her
for
> another woman over a year ago) had to go back to work so we now have her
two
> children for a major part of the time, another close friend left her
husband
> and child for a man she met over the internet, we bought a brand new van
(big
> purchase---also this computer :)---that could be stressful too) and I
could
> go on and on. No wonder he is stressed out! We all should be! I think
we
> all need some down time, and he and I could use some alone time! :)
> Tami
>

Tami,

Sounds a great time to get away just the two of you. Have you heard of
Marriage Encounter? It's a weekend designed to help good marriages into
great ones. The weekend focuses on just the two of you and improving
communication between you. It's not a retreat, nor a marriage clinic, nor
group sensitivity. It's a unique approach aimed at revitalizing Christian
marriage. Sounds like you might enjoy a weekend alone with your dh.

We went 3 years ago (married 16 yrs) and it helped us a lot. I don't think
we would have even started homeschooling this year if we could not discuss
the ideas and be more open to each others feelings.

Think about it. It was great for us.

Sites with more information:

National site: http://www.wwme.org/

Section 6 covers Indiana, Kentucky, Michigan, Ohio, and West Virginia.
http://www.rc.net/org/me6/index.html

Section 8 covers Minnesota, North & South Dakota
http://studio.cloudnet.com/wwme/

Hope you get a chance to get away. It sounds like you guys deserve to get
away and make a weekend after all the stresses you guys have had.

Brigitte
